segments.text: I can't take my eyes off that wobbly stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is really stretching, reaching deep into that cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His weight is shifting, and the stool is visibly swaying.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It looks like it could go over backward at any moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: My heart is pounding just watching him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The thought of him falling and hurting himself is truly concerning.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And what if he drops all those cookies and breaks the plate?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His little sister is so close, she might get caught in the fall too.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: No one seems to see the danger but me.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole situation is teetering on the edge, much like that stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's such a precarious position for a child to be in.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just want to grab him and pull him to safety.
segments.speaker: PAR
